snippet: An agency that is supposed to stay as far away from partisan politics as possible has been left in charge — almost by accident — of regulating a huge amount of election spending.
abstract: Internal Revenue Service discloses that is had more closely scrutinized applications for tax-exempt status from conservative-sounding groups to insure they were not abusing limitations on political activity.
lead_paragraph: An agency that is supposed to stay as far away from partisan politics as possible has been left in charge — almost by accident — of regulating a huge amount of election spending.

headline.seo: Uneven I.R.S. Scrutiny Seen in Political Spending by Big Tax-Exempt Groups
headline.main: Uneven I.R.S. Scrutiny Seen in Political Spending by Big Tax-Exempt Groups
headline.print_headline: Uneven I.R.S. Scrutiny Seen in Political Spending by Big Tax-Exempt Groups
